title: MySQLASIN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLASIN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the arc sine of a number:
SELECT ASIN(0.25);

Definition and Usage
The ASIN() function returns the arc sine of a number.
The specified number must be between -1 to 1, otherwise 
this function returns NULL.
Syntax
ASIN(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the arc sine of a number:
SELECT ASIN(-0.8);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLASIN()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLASIN()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLASIN()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
